description: The Timneh African Grey is slightly smaller and darker than the Congo African Grey, with a horn-colored upper beak and a maroon tail. They are known for their intelligence and early talking ability.
temperament: Intelligent, sensitive, and can be more reserved than the Congo. They are known to be less prone to anxiety.
loudness: Moderate. Can be loud, but generally quieter than many other large parrots.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Excellent talkers and mimics, often starting at a younger age than Congos. Their voice is less a perfect imitation and more their 'own' voice.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet, supplemented with fresh vegetables, fruits, and some nuts. They require adequate calcium and Vitamin A.
healthPointers: Can live for 50-80 years. Prone to calcium deficiency, Vitamin A and D deficiency, respiratory infections, and feather plucking if bored or stressed.
housing: Needs a large space. A minimum cage size of 36"W x 24"D x 48"H is recommended. Not ideal for apartments unless the owner is home a lot and can manage noise.
